org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.validation

Class EmailValidator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.validation.EmailValidator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Model type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validator<T,String>

    public class EmailValidator<T>
extends Object
implements Validator<T,String>
    Validator for textual values that should follow the email pattern. Null values are optionally invalidated.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

      Creates a EmailValidator with given message for invalid results.

      Creates a EmailValidator with given message for invalid results.
      EmailValidator(String invalidMessage, boolean required, String nullMessage)
      Creates a EmailValidator with messages for invalid email values and null values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmailValidator

        public EmailValidator(String message)
        Creates a EmailValidator with given message for invalid results.

        This validator will successfully validate null values.

        Parameters:
        message - invalid message

      • EmailValidator

        public EmailValidator(String message,
              boolean required)
        Creates a EmailValidator with given message for invalid results.

        Null (and empty) values will be invalidated as well.

        Parameters:
        message - invalid message

      • EmailValidator

        public EmailValidator(String invalidMessage,
              boolean required,
              String nullMessage)
        Creates a EmailValidator with messages for invalid email values and null values. When a validation with a *null* or *empty* string occurs then an invalid Validation is returned with the #nullMessage inside. Differently, if a non-empty string is given, but don't satisfy the requirements, then an invalid Validation with the #invalidMessage is returned.
        Parameters:
        invalidMessage - invalid email message
        nullMessage - null value message

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public Validation validate(T object,
                  String value)
        Description copied from interface: Validator
        Validates a value to be set in a model and returns a Validation. The validation contains a flag informing if it was valid or not and a ValidationMessage provided with a textual user-friendly message and a ValidationMessage.Type.

        The lack of an property's id argument does not limits its implementation because the property is known by the time of binding.

        Specified by:
        validate in interface Validator<T,String>
        Parameters:
        object - model which will hold (or not) the value
        value - value being passed to the model
        Returns:
        validation result
